sen.j: 長福寺（ちょうふくじ）は、奈良県生駒市俵口町にある真言律宗の寺院。
sen.e: Chofukuji-Temple, situated at Tawaraguchicho, Ikoma City in Nara Prefecture, is the temple of Shingon sect of Buddhism.
Chofuku-ji Temple is a temple of the Shingon Ritsu sect of Buddhism, situated at Tawaraguchicho, Ikoma City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ・「Chofukuji-Temple」のハイフンを修正しました。・真言律宗の唯一の寺院ではないため、templeは不定冠詞にしました。・「真言律宗」の訳語を用語集に合わせ修正しました。(ただし、「Shingon Risshu sect」という表記もあるようです。）・文章の流れを自然な定義文形式にしました。・住所の書き方（県のコンマ）を一般的な形式に修正しました。
sen.e: Chofuku-ji Temple is a temple of the Shingon Ritsu sect of Buddhism, situated at Tawaraguchicho, Ikoma City, Nara Prefecture.
Its honorific mountain prefix is Kinryusan.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Kinryusan.
sen.cmt: ・「山号」は用語集の訳語に合わせました。
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Kinryusan.

sen.j: 開基は行基、本尊は阿弥陀如来坐像。
sen.e: Its kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) was Gyoki and its principal image is the Amitabha seated statue.
Its kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) was Gyoki and its principal image is the seated statue of Amidanyorai (Amitabha).
sen.cmt: ・「阿弥陀如来坐像」を用語集の訳語に合わせました。・余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Its kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) was Gyoki and its principal image is the seated statue of Amidanyorai (Amitabha).

sen.j: 寺伝によると奈良時代に聖武天皇の勅願により僧・行基が開創したと伝えられるが、詳細は不明である。
sen.e: According to the legend, it is said that Gyoki, a Buddhist priest, founded the temple at the request of Emperor Shomu in the Nara period, but the details are not clear.
According to the legend, it is said that Gyoki, a Buddhist priest, founded the temple at the request of Emperor Shomu in the Nara period, but the details are not clear.
According to the legend, it is said that Gyoki, a Buddhist priest, founded the temple at the request of Emperor Shomu in the Nara period, but the details are not clear.
Hondo,the main hall (an important cultural property)
Hondo, the main hall (important cultural property)
sen.cmt: ・スペースを追加・削除しました。・不定冠詞は不要と思われますので削除しました。
sen.e: Hondo, the main hall (important cultural property)

sen.j: 鎌倉時代後期に建立された入母屋造 ・本瓦葺の建物。
sen.e: The main hall was constructed with a hip-and gable tiled roof in the latter part of the Kamakura period.
The main hall was constructed with the Irimoya-styled roof (hip-and-gable roof) in the latter part of the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 「入母屋造 ・本瓦葺」を用語集の訳語に合わせました。
sen.e: The main hall was constructed with the Irimoya-styled roof (hip-and-gable roof) in the latter part of the Kamakura period.
National Treasure
National Treasure
National Treasure

sen.j: 金銅能作生塔（のうさしょうとう）
sen.e: Kondo-Nosashoto (the miniature pagoda made of gilt bronze)
Kondo Nosa Shoto (The bronze pagoda)
sen.cmt: 用語集の訳語に合わせました。
sen.e: Kondo Nosa Shoto (The bronze pagoda)

sen.j: 鎌倉時代の代表的な金工作品といえる銅製の能作生塔（万物生成をつかさどる根源の珠・如意宝珠を納める塔）。
sen.e: The 'Nosashoto' (the miniature pagoda which contains the 'Nyoihoju', 'cintamani' which presides over all creation in the universe) is considered as a typical example of metalwork in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Nosa Shoto (the miniature pagoda which contains nyoi hoju [a sacred jewel, said to remove suffering, and capable of granting every wish], 'cintamani' which presides over all creation in the universe) is considered as a typical example of metalwork in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: ・「能作生塔」のつづりを用語集に合わせました。・「如意宝珠」を用語集の訳語に合わせました。・引用符は不要な個所は削除しました。
sen.e: The Nosa Shoto (the miniature pagoda which contains nyoi hoju [a sacred jewel, said to remove suffering, and capable of granting every wish], 'cintamani' which presides over all creation in the universe) is considered as a typical example of metalwork in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 頂には三方火焔付き宝珠を蓮台にのせ、塔身部は魚々子（ななこ）地に蓮華唐草文様を線刻し鍍金・鍍銀を施こされている。
sen.e: On the top of the pagoda, the 'Hoju (sacred gem)' with ornamental flames rising from three sides is seated upon the lotus base and the body of the tower displays twill-woven metal, gilt with copper and gold, and engraved with lotus flowers and an arabesque design.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: On the top of the pagoda, the 'Hoju (sacred gem)' with ornamental flames rising from three sides is seated upon the lotus base and the body of the tower displays twill-woven metal, gilt with copper and gold, and engraved with lotus flowers and an arabesque design.

On the top of the pagoda, the 'Hoju (sacred gem)' with ornamental flames rising from three sides is seated upon the lotus base and the body of the tower displays twill-woven metal, gilt with copper and gold, and engraved with lotus flowers and an arabesque design.
(The treasure is deposited in the Tokyo National Museum.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (The treasure is deposited in the Tokyo National Museum.)
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: (The treasure is deposited in the Tokyo National Museum.)

sen.j: 木造聖徳太子立像（孝養太子像）
sen.e: Mokuzo Shotokutaishu Ritsuzo (The wooden standing statue of Prince Shotoku or Kotoku (faithful) Taishi.)
Mokuzo Shotokutaishi Ritsuzo (The wooden standing statue of Prince Shotoku or Kotoku [faithful] Taishi)
sen.cmt: ・「聖徳太子」のスペルを修正しました。・余分なスペースを削除しました。・余分なピリオドを削除しました。・丸括弧の中の括弧は統一事項に沿って[]に修正しました。
sen.e: Mokuzo Shotokutaishi Ritsuzo (The wooden standing statue of Prince Shotoku or Kotoku [faithful] Taishi)

sen.j: 近鉄奈良線生駒駅から奈良交通バス（生駒台循環）「俵口阪奈中央病院」下車
sen.e: From Kintetsu Nara Line Ikoma Station, take Nara Kotsu Bus (Ikomadai loop-line) to 'Tawaraguchi Hanna Chuo Hospital'.
From Kintetsu Nara Line Ikoma Station, take Nara Kotsu Bus (Ikomadai loop-line) to 'Tawaraguchi Hanna Chuo Hospital.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: From Kintetsu Nara Line Ikoma Station, take Nara Kotsu Bus (Ikomadai loop-line) to 'Tawaraguchi Hanna Chuo Hospital.'
